DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Population Subgroup Consent Form Signature Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The month, day, and year the recipient signed the clinical study population subgroup consent form.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Population Subgroup Consent Form Signature
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relatively uniform groups (e.g. etiologically and pathogenetically more homogeneous, racial, ethnic, or gender-specific, or the disease- or condition-specific) of study subjects formed within a clinical study population for a separate analysis. The selection of the subgroups, methods of subgroup analysis, and anticipated difference in observation outcome(s) have to be defined and justified in the study protocol and based on known biological mechanisms, and/or findings in previous studies._A document explaining all the relevant information to assist an individual in understanding the expectations and risks in making a decision about a procedure. This document is presented to and signed by the individual or guardian._Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; having a handwritten signature.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Clinical Study Population Subgroup Consent Form
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relatively uniform groups (e.g. etiologically and pathogenetically more homogeneous, racial, ethnic, or gender-specific, or the disease- or condition-specific) of study subjects formed within a clinical study population for a separate analysis. The selection of the subgroups, methods of subgroup analysis, and anticipated difference in observation outcome(s) have to be defined and justified in the study protocol and based on known biological mechanisms, and/or findings in previous studies.:A document explaining all the relevant information to assist an individual in understanding the expectations and risks in making a decision about a procedure. This document is presented to and signed by the individual or guardian.

Concepts.definition: Relatively uniform groups (e.g. etiologically and pathogenetically more homogeneous, racial, ethnic, or gender-specific, or the disease- or condition-specific) of study subjects formed within a clinical study population for a separate analysis. The selection of the subgroups, methods of subgroup analysis, and anticipated difference in observation outcome(s) have to be defined and justified in the study protocol and based on known biological mechanisms, and/or findings in previous studies.

A document explaining all the relevant information to assist an individual in understanding the expectations and risks in making a decision about a procedure. This document is presented to and signed by the individual or guardian.

Property.preferredDefinition: Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; an identifying feature or characteristic of something or someone; an alternative term for motif or pattern; the part of the prescription that contains directions to the patient for taking of medicine.

Concepts.definition: Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; having a handwritten signature.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
